items.title: To lead in AI, start smaller
items.description: If you want people to adopt AI, you must change the systems that guide them.

items.title: Marketing leaders say AI is rewriting how brands reach Gen Z and millennials: ‘Forget what you know; learn this’
items.description: Top executives say AI is helping their users lean into being more personable.

items.title: $50 billion fintech CEO says stop selling AI. Customers don’t care and ‘just want their problem solved’
items.description: The CEO of the largest digital bank says stop peddling new technology as your selling point.

items.title: This is the worst the jobs market has looked (outside of a recession) in 50 years, says Goldman Sachs, meaning bullish GDP estimates are too optimistic
items.description: Jan Hatzius warns America’s job market slump could drag down growth, with frontloaded orders and AI disruption skewing GDP signals.

items.title: Experts say the high failure rate in AI adoption isn’t a bug, but a feature: ‘Has anybody ever started to ride a bike on the first try?’
items.description: At Fortune's Most Powerful Women event, one thing was clear: We're still on the "jagged frontier" of AI adoption.
